name: Pollo Guisado (Puerto Rican Chicken Stew)
description: Warm your bones and fill your belly with Pollo Guisado, a hearty Puerto Rican chicken stew packed with flavor that's easy to make and ready to devour in under an hour.
recipeIngredient: 1.5 lb chicken thighs, boneless and skinless ($4.49)

recipeInstructions.text: Dry the chicken thighs thoroughly with paper towels. Cut into 2-inch cubes. Season with Adobo.
recipeInstructions.name: Dry the chicken thighs thoroughly with paper towels. Cut into 2-inch cubes. Season with Adobo.

recipeInstructions.text: Set a Dutch oven over medium-high heat.Â Add the oil. Once it has warmed, add the chicken in one layer and brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Set a Dutch oven over medium-high heat.Â Add the oil. Once it has warmed, add the chicken in one layer and brown.

recipeInstructions.text: Once the chicken has browned, remove it from the pot and set it aside.Â Add the onion to the pot, and cook until translucent, about 2 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Once the chicken has browned, remove it from the pot and set it aside.Â Add the onion to the pot, and cook until translucent, about 2 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the sofrito and tomato sauce. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes until it is thick and bubbly.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the sofrito and tomato sauce. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes until it is thick and bubbly.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the sazÃ³n, bay leaves, oregano, olives, potatoes, carrots, and chicken broth. Bring the mixture to a boil.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the sazÃ³n, bay leaves, oregano, olives, potatoes, carrots, and chicken broth. Bring the mixture to a boil.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the chicken back into the pot. Lower the heat, cover the pot, and simmer for 40-50 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the chicken back into the pot. Lower the heat, cover the pot, and simmer for 40-50 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.

recipeInstructions.text: Take the stew off the heat, sample it, and add salt and pepper to taste. Remove the bay leaves before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Take the stew off the heat, sample it, and add salt and pepper to taste. Remove the bay leaves before serving.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely delicious!  I may have added two much broth but quick fix with cornstarch and back to perfection.  The flavor was spot on just like Mom's, day two tasted even better.  Thank you!
Wow, I made this with the coconut rice and I canâ€™t believe how good it was. I donâ€™t love coconut but took a shot with it and was blown away. Highly advise trying this with it. A+ recipe.
Great recipe.  You should probably take the prices out though, they're not remotely accurate.
This is great! Quick question what size Dutch oven are you using?
I wanted a new recipe  for leftover rotisserie chicken.  I made this pollo guisado, it was absolutely delicious.
This was phenomenal ðŸ”¥. A hit especially with my husband. He wants it once a week now ðŸ˜‚. Thank you for sharing

Delicious.  I had to buy the sazon and adobo and have enough to last me a lifetime; so I guess I have to make it a few more times.  Can you suggest other recipes that might use them?
I think chickpeas would be a good substitute for the potatoes.  Any thoughts?
This stew is delicious!  My husband is Puerto Rican and I wanted to make a pollo guisado like his mom's.  He has said that this beats his mom's recipe, but don't let her know.
Excellent. Muy bueno que me quedo. Use alas.(chicken wings) Le aÃ±adi un cubito de pollo.
